result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Michael Kruchten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Obtain HSED/GED.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Jacob G. or Peyton Z.
No violent contact with co-defendant Jena H.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Adam Michael Kruchten in court with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files read-in list.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

125 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling - obtain HSED/GED 
____No contact with: Jacob G.  or Peyton Z. 
____No violent contact with Co-Defendant Jena H.  

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)


***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.
